æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Weblogic 12.2.1.3.0ã€12.2.1.4.0å’Œ14.1.1.0.0ç‰ˆæœ¬å› ä¸å½“å¤„ç†åºåˆ—åŒ–å¯¹è±¡è€Œå­˜åœ¨è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œï¼ˆRCEï¼‰æ¼æ´ã€‚æ­¤æ¨¡æ¿åˆ©ç”¨CVE-2020-14644å®ç°RCEã€‚

Template requests

id: CVE-2020-14644

info:
name: Weblogic Remote Command Execution (RCE) Vulnerability
author: MuhammadWaseem
severity: critical
description: |
Weblogic versions 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0, and 14.1.1.0.0 are vulnerable
to remote code execution (RCE) due to improper handling of serialized
objects. This template exploits CVE-2020-14644 to achieve RCE.
tags: weblogic,rce,cve2020,java

http:

  • raw:
    POST /wls-wsat/CoordinatorPortType HTTP/1.1Host: {{Hostname}}Content-Type: text/xmlConnection: close<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:wsa="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">  <soapenv:Header>    <wsa:Action>"http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/09/transfer/Create"</wsa:Action>  </soapenv:Header>  <soapenv:Body>    <test>Exploit Payload</test>  </soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>
    matchers-condition: and
    matchers:
    • type: status
      status:
      • 500
    • type: word
      part: body
      words:
      • â€œweblogic.wsee.jaxws.WsLoggingInterceptorâ€

Anything else?

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Oracle WebLogic Server (10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0) å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼ŒåŸå› æ˜¯æœªç»è®¤è¯çš„è®¿é—®é€šè¿‡IIOPå’ŒT3åè®®ï¼Œå…è®¸ç½‘ç»œæ”»å‡»è€…æ¥ç®¡æœåŠ¡å™¨ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨éœ€è¦é€šè¿‡ç½‘ç»œè®¿é—®IIOPæˆ–T3ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Oracle

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š WebLogic Server

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š product:â€oracle weblogicâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12228

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Oracle WebLogic Server (10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0) contains a remote code execution caused by unauthenticated access via IIOP and T3 protocols, letting network attackers take over the server, exploit requires network access via IIOP or T3.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://github.com/Qynklee/POC_CVE-2020-2883
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/7960bb5df13e
  • https///github.com:Qynklee/POC_CVE-2020-2883.git
  • https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2020-2883
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/407219371c37
  • https///github.com:Al1ex/CVE-2020-2883.git
  • https://github.com/FancyDoesSecurity/CVE-2020-2883
  • https://github.com/Y4er/WebLogic-Shiro-shell
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/da7b6fb2895f
  • https///github.com:Y4er/WebLogic-Shiro-shell.git
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/9ab580b3f80b
  • https///gitee.com:akira09/exphub.git
  • https://github.com/ZZZWD/CVE-2020-2883
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/d55ddb5fac32
  • https///github.com:zzwlpx/weblogicPoc.git
  • https://github.com/MagicZer0/Weblogic_CVE-2020-2883_POC
  • https://github.com/Y4er/CVE-2020-2883
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/7927833b7021
  • https///github.com:Y4er/CVE-2020-2883.git
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/f0337df1320b
  • https///github.com:0xn0ne/weblogicScanner.git

KEV: True

Shodan Query: product:"oracle weblogic"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š title:â€Nacosâ€

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Template IDs or paths

Environment

Steps To Reproduce

The three URLs in this template were not executed in a top-down order but rather in the sequence DELETE -> GET -> POST. This resulted in a failure to successfully detect the Nacos unauthorized access vulnerability during the scan, leading to the incorrect conclusion that Nacos had authentication and authorization enabled.

Please refer to the scan logs.

Relevant dumped responses

Anything else?

I adjusted the template
